executive_summary: The Electric Submersible Pump Manufacturing industry is dependent on demand from petroleum companies. Electric submersible pumps (ESPs) are a type of downhole device used on drilling rigs to provide artificial lift for subterranean liquids. According to industry leader Schlumberger Ltd., only an estimated 5.0% of the world's nearly 1.0 million oil- and gas-producing wells flow naturally, so much of the world's oil and gas production relies on artificial lift equipment such as ESPs. Therefore, changes in price and production volumes of oil and gas affect demand for ESPs.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: ESPs grew in popularity in the past decade
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: ESPs, which can be used in both vertical and horizontal wells, have grown in popularity during the past decade because they are versatile, can pump large volumes and can break through deep reserves.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Revenue declined 11.0% in 2020 due to COVID-19
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: However, the outbreak of the coronavirus decelerated the growth trend, resulting in an 11.0% decline in industry revenue in 2020 as oil prices and oil production plummeted.
As energy markets recover from the effects of the pandemic, industry revenue is expected to grow 9.1% in 2021.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Revenue expected to grow 2.2% annually to 2026
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the five years to 2026, industry revenue is expected to expand at an annualized rate of 2.2% to $2.6 billion.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Oil production growth to benefit industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Growth in the world production of crude oil is expected to benefit industry operators.
Industry exports will continue to represent a significant portion of industry revenue, rising to 10.9% in 2026.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures electric submersible pumps (ESPs) for oil and gas well drilling. Operators also provide monitoring systems, equipment engineering and other services that complement ESP systems.
key_trends: As energy markets recover from the pandemic, industry revenue is expected to grow
Rising import penetration has continued to threaten domestic operators
Industry profit has declined amid a volatile energy sector and fluctuating input costs
Growing oil production is expected to benefit industry operators
Exports are expected to rebound from their decline trend in the current period
Industry imports will continue to represent a threat to domestic operators
Fluctuations in the price and production volumes of oil and gas affect demand for ESPs

market_segmentation.segment_description: The largest market for the Electric Submersible Pump Manufacturing industry is onshore drilling operations. In 2021, IBISWorld estimates that onshore drilling operations will account for 68.5% of industry revenue.
Offshore drilling operations are expected to represent 20.7% of industry revenue in 2021.
In 2021, exports are expected to reach $250.0 million, accounting for 10.8% of industry revenue.

products_and_services.product_description: ESPs with the target production levels of up to 7,000 BPD are estimated to represent 38.3% of industry revenue in 2021.
ESPs with production levels in the range of 7,001 to 25,000 BPD are estimated to represent 38.3% of industry revenue in 2021.
ESPs with the production levels over 25,000 are estimated to account for 23.4% of industry revenue in 2021.

tier_1_suppliers: Electrical Equipment Wholesaling in the US
Metal Pipe & Tube Manufacturing in the US
Wire & Cable Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Iron & Steel Manufacturing in the US
Iron Ore Mining in the US
tier_2_buyers: Oil & Gas Field Services in the US
Oil & Gas Pipeline Construction in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Rising environmental concerns have put additional pressure on industry operators. As the development of renewable energy sources speeds up, industry operators are expected to experience additional pressure from demand and regulatory standpoints.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Exports are expected to decrease at an annualized rate of 0.7% over the five years to 2021. Among the largest destinations of industry exports are Canada, China, Brazil and South Korea.

Over the five years to 2021, imports are expected to grow at an annualized rate of 5.6%, driven by the growth of imports from Mexico and Taiwan particularly. At the same time, China remains the largest source of industry imports.

business_locations.location_description: The Southwest region is estimated to represent 24.3% of industry establishments. Texas alone is expected to represent 17.6% of electric submersible pump manufacturers in the US.
The Great Lakes region is expected to represent 19.2% of all industry establishments. Within the region, Ohio is estimated to represent 5.0% of industry establishments.
The Southeast region is expected to represent 19.0% of industry establishments.
The West region is expected to represent 12.0% of industry establishments. Within the region, California is estimated to represent 9.7% of industry establishments.
The Mid-Atlantic region is expected to represent 11.3% of industry establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_description: More recent environmental laws and regulations include the federal Clean Air Act (CAA) and the Clean Water Act (CWA). Also, several companies were involved in litigation surrounding the use of asbestos in products, but very few of these cases are expected to significantly affect industry performance.

The CAA aims to limit the emission of harmful air pollutants along with volatile organic compounds (VOCs). Air-pollution control regulations affecting the industry are detailed in titles 1 and 40 of the CAA's Code of Federal Regulations (Parts 50-99).

This act restricts the level of discharge made by pump manufacturers forcing some that have excessive discharge to seek more expensive, alternate forms of waste disposal. Regulating both direct and indirect discharges, the CWA is concerned with what it terms priority, conventional and non-conventional pollutants.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Pump manufacturing requires large factory space, industrial machinery, automated systems and vast energy resources in addition to skilled and semi-skilled human resources.
There are high levels of competition and market share concentration with existing major players being well-established with cost advantages and customer loyalty.

factors_increased_barrier: Life Cycle Stage - The industry is mature
factors_decreased_barrier: Capital Intensity Level - The industry has high capital intensity requirements
Revenue Volatility Level - The industry has high revenue volatility

basis_points.basis_description: Competition in the Electric Submersible Pump Manufacturing industry is largely based on factors such as price, reliability, quality and safety.
The ability of industry operators to provide after-sale services at a reasonable price is equally important to stay competitive.
Competition is also based on reputation since brand loyalty among customers is developed through the provision of quality products over a period of time.
Technical expertise also forms a basis of competition. Operators differentiate themselves by providing specialized technical expertise and service.
Operators also compete based on prompt delivery. Delivery speed and the location of manufacturing facilities are important with respect to after-sale services.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Top 3 companies account for 27.3% market share
concentration_points.concentration_description: In 2021, the top three companies are expected to account for 27.3% of total industry revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, is expected to account for 6.1% of industry revenue in 2021, a decline from 6.4% in 2016. This decline is partly explained by high volatility in revenue during the current period.

Wages are expected to account for 13.5% of industry revenue in 2021, representing a slight increase from 2016 levels. While the industry experienced relatively slow growth during the current period, wages have expanded at a more rapid pace, contributing to an increase in wages' share of revenue.

Like many manufacturing industries, purchases consistently account for the majority of the industry's costs. In particular, steel represents a major input into the production of this industry's pumps, with iron and steel castings accounting for a large portion of all materials consumed.
Purchases have been exceptionally volatile during the five-year period, complicating purchases for industry operators.

Depreciation represents the amount of revenue operators invest into capital equipment such as process machinery and automated systems. While the initial investment for such machinery can be substantial, the cost is usually spread out over a period of several years, thereby marginalizing depreciation costs across most manufacturing industries, including this one.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Electric Submersible Pump Manufacturing industry exhibits a low to moderate level of capital intensity. IBISWorld estimates that for every $1.00 spent on wages, industry operators will spend $0.11 on capital investments.

Skilled workers are also important. Due to the importance of technology innovation to obtain new contracts, competent workers are essential for industry operators to operate. As a result, the average salary in the industry is estimated to reach $77,167 in 2021.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Over the five years to 2021, the level of revenue volatility has been high, based on the absolute changes in revenue from year to year. In 2016, the industry experienced a substantial decline in revenue, driven mainly by a 15.7% decrease in the world price of crude oil.

The outbreak of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic lowered demand for industry products once again as oil production and oil prices fell sharply in that year. In 2021, industry revenue is expected to grow 9.1%, driven by the economic recovery, contributing to further volatility in industry revenue.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The Electric Submersible Pump Manufacturing industry operates under a medium level of technology change. On the one hand, electric submersible pumps (ESPs) are considered a highly efficient and economical tool used in oil extraction, which means that there are few significant improvements to be gained through innovation.

Recently, newer ESPs have shed the requirements of installing an electric cable in the well hole. New coiled-tubing umbilicals enable both the piping and electric cable to be deployed with a single conventional coiled tubing unit. Also, newer ESPs can reinject water into the reservoir without the need to lift it to the surface, where disposal and remediation costs are incurred.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Companies have been forced to make higher quality products to compete with manufacturers abroad.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Industry revenue although lagging a year or two generally follows the trend in crude oil and natural gas prices.

FAQs.question: Have you looked into setting up manufacturing facilities in lower-wage regions of the country?
FAQs.answer: Major operators in the industry have operations abroad. These include both manufacturing and services operations.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in R&D to meet changing consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: Companies consistently invest in technology to keep up with the demand of its upstream customers.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Wage costs have remained high as low wage jobs have moved abroad.

FAQs.question: What steps do you take to safeguard your company's proprietary information?
FAQs.answer: Companies routinely file for patents on technologies and processes it develops.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Regulations have remained steady over the past five years in this industry and have not drastically affected industry operations.

FAQs.question: How have international tariffs impacted your ability to import and export products?
FAQs.answer: There are no additional tariffs that impact this industry.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare with your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Large operators often maintain profit margins at or above 10.0%, higher than the industry average.

FAQs.question: How has input price volatility affected profit margins over the past 12 months?
FAQs.answer: Rising steel prices have increased operators' purchase costs.
